ygData.subject: Re: Flirting
ygData.msgSnippet: I have a neat trick of turning most potential suitors into big brothers. =)  Saves everyone s feelings, and gets into the roleplay.  The funny thing is, I m
ygData.messageBody:
I have a neat trick of turning most potential suitors into big brothers. =) Saves everyone's feelings, and gets into the roleplay. The funny thing is, I'm older than
most of them IRL....heh. I DID have a very amusing night when I was in Qeynos. There was a lot of /ooc going on with these two guys getting drunk. They spent over 50
plat on booze. Well, one of them decides he needs to get married. Apparently he did a /who on the zone, and got me. So, in /ooc, he starts proposing. I shoot him
down. He offers a ring. I tell him he's a filthy human and not for the likes of me. He offers to stay home with the kids. I shoot him down again. By this time, half
of the zone is in /ooc taking bets and making jokes and cheering him on and egging me on and well.......it was great fun, he sent me a /tell later thanking me for
playing along, and I have a new friend. By the way, he DID get married in game later on that month.........lol.

Sara, Povar

truffle@... wrote:

> From: truffle@...
>
> When I went on to everquest I was concerned that there
> might be a lot of flirting, and that it might get out
> of hand. I accordingly played my character with a
> cold exterior (not hard for a dark elf necromancer).
>
> I've come to warm up to flirting a bit, though I
> still don't do it very much. I've generally found that most guys are fairly polite, or at worst a bit boisterous.
>
> My wood elf druid gets hit on more than my other
> characters. My dwarven paladin is hit on very consistently by dwarves (but not other races).
>
> I've made lots of friends throughout Mithanial Marr, but I'm hoping as well to join a decent guild at some point, for the increased socialization, and group hunting.
>
> - Christina
>
